text:
Putting RewriteEngine/RewriteRule inside Location is meaningless to Apache (i.e.
nothing happens). Location is not an allowed container for
RewriteEngine/RewriteRule.

However, when doing so, Apache does not log any problem into its error log at
startup. 

It should.
creator: bughunt@gluino.name
bobsiegen@googlemail.com
text:
What can you find in your RewriteLog? It should work, but remember, you're
matching against the full physical path, e.g. /var/www/htdocs/foo.html. There is
no directory prefix, so nothing will be stripped.

However, using mod_rewrite in <files> and <location> sections should work, but
is unsupported.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
See "Per-directory Rewrites" under
http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_rewrite.html#rewriterule

They do work in <Location>, they just work very weirdly.  I think the
documentation is clear about that, and adding a warning message would just annoy
people who have managed to find something in <Location> that works.
